author: adityapatwardhan
body:
## Name

TestGetFormatDataAndExportFormatData
## File

C:\PowerShellTests\PowerShell\Win8\PowerShell\legacy\utscripts\Commands\TestGetFormatDataAndExportFormatData.ps1
## Repro

```
(Get-FormatData System.Diagnostics.Process).FormatViewDefinition.Count
```
## Expected

4

**Name      Control**
process   TableControl
Priority  TableControl
StartTime TableControl
process   WideControl
## Actual

2
**Name    Control**
process System.Management.Automation.TableControl
process System.Management.Automation.WideControl

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

PS C:\Windows\system32> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.10032.0
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v0.5.0-228-gd453bfd4b97e7f7a4569360b2e386a326268ea8c
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1


```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
This issue repros on Win10 with build 14387.1000.amd64fre.rs1_srv_ps_dev.160711-1500.
Is this a bad test, or a real regression in product?

comments.author: ThomasNieto
comments.body:
Is this still an issue? I see all 4 formats for this type.

```powershell
C:\> (Get-FormatData System.Diagnostics.Process).FormatViewDefinition.Count
4
C:\> (Get-FormatData System.Diagnostics.Process)

TypeNames                    FormatViewDefinition
---------                    --------------------
{System.Diagnostics.Process} {process, Priority, StartTime, process}
```

title: TestGetFormatDataAndExportFormatData test fails as the FormatViewDefinition of System.Diagnostics.Process are not as expected
